intro: Collaea diversifolia, commonly known as the variable collaea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
